H0.text: Rocks are made of one or more minerals, which is what all rocks have in common when students compare different rocks.

H1.text: Rocks are made of two or more elements, the common feature that all rocks share when students compare different rocks.

H2.text: Rocks are made of magma and sediments, which is what all rocks have in common when students compare different rocks.

H3.text: Rocks are made of sand changed by pressure, which is what all rocks have in common when students compare different rocks.

A4.text: Rocks are composed primarily of grains of minerals, which are crystalline solids formed from atoms chemically bonded into an orderly structure.

A5.text: Metamorphic rocks are formed when existing rocks are subjected to such high pressures and temperatures that they are transformed without significant melting.
